docs.snippet: The joint resolution from the House was received making an appropriation of $1,000 for illuminating the public buildings on Saturday evening, the 22d inst., and, on motion of Mr. ANTHONY, of Rhode Island, (Rep.,) it was passed.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; The Rebels Reported to be Retiring from Centreville. The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad to be Opened Immediately. The Proposed solicitor of Customs at New-York. Action of the House on the Treasury Note Bill. Disagreement with the senate Amendments. COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE APPOINTED. An Inquiry into the Loyalty of Senator Powell, of Kentucky.

docs.abstract: Dispatches from Washington and report on Congress proceedings
docs.lead_paragraph: THE REBELS FALLING BACK FROM CENTREVILLE. Information has been received that the rebels have in part, fallen back from Centreville. This has been obtained from scouting parties from several of the military divisions, who reported this morning, and who all agree in the statement. It is supposed the rebels are influenced by a military necessity, being apprehensive of the cutting off of their supplies.

headline.main: OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES.; THE TREASURY NOTE BILL. REBEL BLOCKADE IN THE WEST BROKEN UP. PROVISIONAL GOVERNMENT IN TENNESSEE. LOUISVILLE AND NASHVILLE RAILROAD. docs.abstract: Dispatches from Washington and report on Congress proceedings; Proceedings
docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee of Ways and Means recommend that the House agree to about two-thirds of the Senate's amendments to the Treasury Note Bill, and that they disagree to those reducing the number of United States Notes authorized to be issued, from $150,000,000 to $100,000,000, and to the striking out of the original proviso that $50,000,000 of the Notes shall begin lieu of the demand Treasury Notes authorized by act of July last, etc.

byline.original: From the Albany Journal of Last Evening

docs.snippet: Our citizens were startled this morning by the announcement that Col. SAMUEL PRUYN was dead. The announcement came with paralyzing suddenness to those who met him, in his usual robust health and spirits, last evening--rejoicing with his...

headline.main: Sudden Death of Col. Samuel Pruyn.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our citizens were startled this morning by the announcement that Col. SAMUEL PRUYN was dead. The announcement came with paralyzing suddenness to those who met him, in his usual robust health and spirits, last evening--rejoicing with his fellow-citizens over the good news brought to us from the seat of war. No man was happier, or seemed more likely to pass on healthfully into a green old age.

docs.snippet: At a regular meeting of this Board last evening, a resolution offered by Mr.FROMENT was adopted, that the Committee on National Affairs take suitable measures for the reception of Col. CORCORAN and his fellow-prisoners on their arrival in this City.

docs.snippet: It is believed here by military men that Manassas will be evacuated by the rebels, as Bowling Green has been. No doubt is entertained that the rebellion is thoroughly crushed.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; The Probable Speedy Evacuation of Manassas.THE END OF THE REBELLION NEARDesire of the Rebel Leaders forForeign Arbitration.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES THE EVACUATION OF MANASSAS PROBABLE. THE MAILS IN TENNESSEE. THE REBELS WANT FOREIGN ARBITRATION. GEN. PREMONT. DR. RUSSELL SNUBBED. NO NEWS FROM FORT DONELSON. COL. WILCOX. MAILS FROM PORT ROYAL, ETC. EXCLUDED. WATER TRANSPORTS,

docs.lead_paragraph: It is believed here by military men that Manassas will be evacuated by the rebels, as Bowling Green has been. No doubt is entertained that the rebellion is thoroughly crushed.

docs.snippet: Reports from private sources say that the enemy have completed their strong fort on the Catoctin Mountain. If covers one and a half acres of ground and platforms are prepared for twenty guns, but only four have yet been mounted.

headline.main: AFFAIRS ON THE UPPER POTOMAC.; A Rebel Fort on Catoctin Mountain Movements of the Enemy A Murder A Flag ofTruco Again Outraged.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reports from private sources say that the enemy have completed their strong fort on the Catoctin Mountain. If covers one and a half acres of ground and platforms are prepared for twenty guns, but only four have yet been mounted.
